title: Pointer Sisters - Discography 1982-1989
description:
POINTER SISTERS  - Discography 1982-1989

Codec: mp3.
Description: MPEG-1 Audio Layer 3.
Bit rate: 320 kbps.
Sample rate: 44100 Hz joint stereo.
Tags type: ID3V1 & ID3V2.
Source formats: CD.
Number of tracks: 60.

Five albums with the Pointer Sisters from their golden era; So Excited! (1982, including "I'm So Excited", "If You Wanna Get Back Your Lady", "See How The Love Goes", "American Music" and "Heart To Heart" and also their version of Prince/Chaka Khan's "I Feel For You"), Break Out (1983, "I Need You", "Jump (For My Love)", "Automatic", "Neutron Dance", "Baby Come And Get It"), Contact (1985, "Dare Me", "Twist My Arm", "Freedom", "Back In My Arms"), Hot Together (1986, "Goldmine", "Mercury Rising", "All I Know Is The Way I Feel") and Serious Slammin' (1988, "He Turned Me Out", "Moonlight Dancing", later covered by Bette Midler, and "I'm In Love") plus the excellent 1989 compilation Greatest Hits including seven twelve-inch mixes and early classics like "Slow Hand", "He's So Shy" and Bruce Springsteen's "Fire". Note: these are the original Planet/RCA versions produced by Richard Perry, no re-recordings or live versions.

Enjoy - and thanks in advance for seeding.
